X-eGroups-Approved-By: dsaff <david@...> via email; 21 Jan 2011 20:38:19 -0000

I have written a simple custom selector for ANT. Used as follows

<batchtest todir="target/junit">
<fileset dir="${test-classes}">
<custom classname="uk.co.optrak.tools.ant.JUnitSelector"
                         classpathref="path.selector"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>

It matches class files which either extend TestCase or contain methods 
marked with @Test but not @Ignore. It also checks @Category annotations 
so the matched set can be restricted by

<param name="include" value="org.category.BigBadTest"/>
or
<param name="exclude" value="org.category.BigBadTest"/>

The category test doesn't respect the class heirarchy (i.e. only exact 
matches, not super/sub classes). This was done for simplicity in the 
initial implementation.

I can make the code available if anyone is interested.

Mark
